fitness.instructions: Start in a high plank position with your hands under your shoulders. Lower your body until your chest nearly touches the floor. Push back up to the starting position.
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart. Lower your body as if sitting back into a chair, keeping your chest up. Return to standing.
Start in a forearm plank position with your elbows directly under your shoulders. Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
Stand with feet hip-width apart, barbell in front of you. Bend at the hips and knees to grasp the bar, then lift it by straightening your hips and knees.
Stand with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended. Curl the weights up to your shoulders while keeping your elbows close to your torso.
Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder-width. Swing the kettlebell between your legs and then up to shoulder height by driving your hips forward.
Hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height, then press them overhead until your arms are fully extended. Lower back to shoulder height.
Sit at the lat pulldown machine, grasp the bar with a wide grip, and pull it down to your chest. Slowly return to the starting position.
Stand upright and place one heel on a bench or step. Lean forward slightly to feel a stretch in the hamstring of the elevated leg.
Stand upright with feet together and arms at your sides. Jump your feet out while raising your arms overhead, then return to the starting position.
Lie flat on a bench with a barbell. Lower the bar to your chest and push it back up to the starting position.
Step forward with one leg and lower your hips until both knees are bent at a 90-degree angle. Push back to the starting position.
Grasp a pull-up bar with an overhand grip. Pull your body up until your chin is above the bar, then lower back down.
Start in a plank position and alternate driving your knees towards your chest as quickly as possible.
Lie on your back with your legs extended. Lift your legs until they are perpendicular to the floor, then lower them back down.
Place your hands behind you on a bench or chair. Lower your body by bending your elbows, then push back up to the starting position.
Sit on the floor with your knees bent, lean back slightly, and twist your torso to each side, tapping the floor with your hands.
Start in a standing position, drop into a squat, kick your feet back into a plank, return to the squat position, and jump up.
With a dumbbell in each hand, bend at the waist with your back straight. Pull the dumbbells towards your torso, then lower them back down.
Hold a kettlebell at chest level and squat down as if sitting in a chair. Return to standing.
Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
Hold a dumbbell with both hands overhead, then lower it behind your head by bending your elbows. Extend your arms back to the starting position.
Lie on one side with your legs straight. Lift your hips so your body forms a straight line, supporting yourself on one forearm.
Stand in the middle of a cable machine with handles in each hand. With a slight bend in your elbows, bring your hands together in front of your chest.
Step onto a bench or box with one foot, then push through that foot to lift your body up. Step back down and repeat on the other side.
Stand with feet hip-width apart, bend forward at the hips, and row the barbell towards your torso. Lower it back down.
Lie on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand. Press the weights straight up over your chest, then lower them back down.
Stand in front of a sturdy box or bench. Jump onto the box, landing softly, then step back down.
Hang from a pull-up bar and raise your legs until they are parallel to the floor. Lower them back down slowly.
Hold a heavy dumbbell in each hand at your sides and walk forward while maintaining a straight posture.
Stand with the balls of your feet on the edge of a step. Raise your heels as high as possible, then lower them back down.
Hold the ends of the ropes in each hand. Alternate waves with your arms to move the ropes up and down as quickly as possible.
Lift a medicine ball overhead and slam it down on the ground with as much force as possible. Catch it on the rebound and repeat.
Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Bend at the hips and knees to lower the weights, then lift back up.
Hold a barbell at shoulder height. Use your legs to help press the bar overhead, then lower it back to the starting position.
Run on a treadmill at a speed and incline that challenges your endurance.
Lie on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand. Press the weights up and together over your chest, then lower them back down.
Start in a plank position with a dumbbell in each hand. Row one dumbbell towards your torso while balancing on the other hand.
Sit on a leg press machine with your feet shoulder-width apart on the platform. Push the platform away by extending your legs.
Stand facing a cable machine with a high pulley. Push the handle downwards until your arms are fully extended.
Stand on one leg, holding a dumbbell in the opposite hand. Bend at the hips to lower the weight while extending the free leg behind you.
Lie under a bar or suspension trainer, pull your chest towards the bar while keeping your body straight, then lower back down.
Stand sideways to a cable machine with the handle at chest height. Push the handle straight out in front of you, resisting the rotation.
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, kettlebell between your feet. Bend at the hips and knees to lift the kettlebell off the ground.
Hang from a pull-up bar and tuck your knees towards your chest, then slowly lower them back down.
Hold a resistance band in front of you with arms extended. Pull the band apart by bringing your hands out to your sides.
Stand lunge-style with one foot behind you on a bench. Lower your hips until your front thigh is parallel to the floor, then push back up.
Sit on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height. Press the weights overhead until your arms are fully extended.
Place your hands on an elevated surface like a bench. Lower your chest towards the surface, then push back up.
Sit on the ground with your upper back against a bench, barbell across your hips. Lift your hips towards the ceiling by squeezing your glutes.
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell with an underhand grip. Curl the bar towards your shoulders, then lower it back down.
Sit at a cable row machine with feet braced. Pull the handle towards your torso, then slowly return to the starting position.
Start in a high plank position. Tap one hand to the opposite shoulder, then switch sides, while keeping your body stable.
Stand with a dumbbell in each hand, arms at your sides. Raise your arms out to the sides until they are parallel to the floor.
Lean against a wall with your feet shoulder-width apart. Slide down until your knees are at a 90-degree angle and hold the position.
Start in a forearm plank position. Bring one knee to the outside of your elbow, then return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.
Stand with a wide stance, toes pointing out. Grasp the barbell with hands inside your knees, and lift it by extending your hips and knees.
Place one knee and hand on a bench for support, row the dumbbell towards your torso with the other hand.
Swing the kettlebell up to shoulder height, then press it overhead. Lower it back down and repeat.
Jump over the rope as it passes under your feet, keeping a steady rhythm.
Step out to the side, bending one knee while keeping the other leg straight. Push back to the starting position.
Sit at a chest fly machine, grasp the handles, and bring them together in front of your chest, then return to the starting position.
Stand on a hack squat machine platform, lower your body by bending your knees, then push back up to the starting position.
Place your feet on an elevated surface, hands on the floor. Lower your chest towards the floor, then push back up.
Attach a resistance band to a high anchor. Pull the band towards your face, leading with your elbows.
Kneel on the floor with an ab wheel in front of you. Roll the wheel forward while keeping your core tight, then roll back.
Lie on your side with legs straight. Lift your top leg towards the ceiling, then lower it back down.
Hold a barbell in front of your thighs. Bend at the hips to lower the bar down your legs, then return to standing.
Hold dumbbells at shoulder height, palms facing you. Rotate your arms as you press the weights overhead, ending with palms facing forward.
Hold the end of a barbell anchored in a landmine attachment. Press the bar overhead with one arm.
Jump straight up and tuck your knees towards your chest, then land softly and repeat.
Lie on your back with legs extended towards the ceiling. Rotate your legs side to side like windshield wipers.
Stand with a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. Shrug your shoulders towards your ears, then lower them back down.
Push a weighted sled across a flat surface, keeping your back straight and core tight.
Stand facing a cable machine with the handle attached to a low pulley. Curl the handle towards your shoulders, then lower it back down.
Bend at the waist with a dumbbell in each hand. Extend your arms straight back, then return to the starting position.
Lie on your back with legs extended. Lift your feet off the ground and alternate kicking them up and down.
Run in place while driving your knees towards your chest as high as possible.
Lift a sledgehammer overhead and slam it down onto a tire or other soft surface.
Step up onto a bench or box laterally with one foot, then bring the other foot up to meet it. Step back down and repeat.
Stand in front of a cable machine with handles at chest height. Press the handles forward, then return to the starting position.
Grip the TRX handles and lean back, keeping your body straight. Pull your chest towards the handles, then lower back down.
Sit on the floor with knees bent, holding a medicine ball. Twist your torso to each side, tapping the ball on the floor.
Bend over with a barbell on the floor. Row the barbell to your torso, then lower it back to the floor each rep.
In a side plank position, lift your top leg towards the ceiling, then lower it back down.
Sit on a hip abduction machine and press your legs apart against the resistance, then return to the starting position.
Stand with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your thighs. Raise your arms in front of you until they are parallel to the floor.
Grip a pull-up bar with an underhand grip. Pull your body up until your chin is above the bar, then lower back down.
Stand in front of a box with a barbell on your shoulders. Squat down until you sit on the box, then stand back up.
Hold the ends of the ropes and create waves by alternating your arms up and down rapidly.
Hold a barbell in the crook of your elbows. Squat down until your thighs are parallel to the floor, then push back up.
Step forward into a lunge, then bring your back foot forward to step into the next lunge.
Swing a kettlebell between your legs, then pull it overhead in one motion.
Lie on your back with one foot on the ground and the other leg extended. Lift your hips towards the ceiling.
Perform push-ups with your hands in the TRX handles, keeping your body straight.
Sit on a leg curl machine and curl the pad down towards your glutes, then return to the starting position.
Lie on an incline bench with a barbell. Press the bar up and together over your chest, then lower it back down.
Stand on a resistance band with feet shoulder-width apart. Bend at the hips and knees to lift the band off the ground.
Lie on a decline bench with a barbell. Lower the bar to your chest, then press it back up.
Step onto a bench with one foot while holding dumbbells, then bring the other foot up to meet it.
Stand next to a cable machine with the handle at the low pulley. Raise your arm out to the side until it is parallel to the floor.
Step backward into a lunge, lowering your hips until both knees are at a 90-degree angle.
Lie on your back with legs extended towards the ceiling. Reach your hands towards your toes.
Sit on a leg extension machine and extend your legs until they are straight, then return to the starting position.
Lie on a bench holding a dumbbell over your chest. Lower the weight behind your head, then pull it back up.
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell. Shrug your shoulders towards your ears, then lower them back down.
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a T-bar. Row the weight towards your torso, then lower it back down.
Stand on one leg holding a dumbbell in each hand. Bend at the hips to lower the weights, then lift back up.
Stand on one leg with the other leg extended in front of you. Lower your hips until your thigh is parallel to the floor, then push back up.
Sit on a leg curl machine and curl the pad down towards your glutes, then return to the starting position.
Swing the kettlebell between your legs and up to shoulder height, driving the movement with your hips.
Sit on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand. Curl the weights up towards your shoulders, then lower them back down.
Lie on a decline bench and sit up, bringing your chest towards your knees.
Start in a side plank position. Lower your hips towards the floor, then lift them back up.
Swing the kettlebell between your legs and up to shoulder height with one hand, driving the movement with your hips.
Lower into a squat, then explode upwards into a jump. Land softly and repeat.
Stand in the middle of a cable machine with handles in each hand. Bring the handles together in front of your chest, then return to the starting position.
Hold a dumbbell with both hands overhead, then lower it behind your head by bending your elbows. Extend your arms back to the starting position.
Lie face down on a leg curl machine and curl the pad towards your glutes, then return to the starting position.
Start in a push-up position with one hand behind your back. Lower your body until your chest nearly touches the floor, then push back up.
Sit on a shoulder press machine, grasp the handles, and press them overhead until your arms are fully extended.
Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointing out. Lower your hips until your thighs are parallel to the floor, then push back up.
Stand on a resistance band with feet shoulder-width apart. Squat down while holding the band at shoulder height.
Stand on one leg with the other leg extended in front of you. Lower your hips until your thigh is parallel to the floor, then push back up.
Place one end of a barbell in a landmine attachment. Row the other end towards your torso with both hands, then lower it back down.
Lie face down on the floor with arms extended. Lift your arms, chest, and legs off the ground simultaneously, then lower them back down.
Lie on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand. Lower the weights out to the sides of your chest, then bring them back together over your chest.
Stand with feet hip-width apart, bend forward at the hips, and raise the dumbbells out to the sides until they are parallel to the floor.
Attach an ankle strap to a low cable pulley. Kick your leg back while keeping your knee slightly bent, then return to the starting position.
Hold a kettlebell at shoulder height. Use your legs to help press the kettlebell overhead, then lower it back down.
Lie on your back with arms extended towards the ceiling. Lower opposite arm and leg towards the floor while keeping your back flat.
Stand under the bar of a Smith machine. Squat down until your thighs are parallel to the floor, then push back up.
Lie face down on a hyperextension bench with your hips off the end. Lift your legs towards the ceiling, then lower them back down.
Hold the end of a barbell anchored in a landmine attachment. Rotate the bar side to side while keeping your core tight.
Sit at a rowing machine with feet braced. Pull the handles towards your torso, then slowly return to the starting position.
Sit on a calf raise machine with the balls of your feet on the platform. Raise your heels as high as possible, then lower them back down.
Hold a kettlebell overhead with one arm, then bend at the waist while reaching towards the floor with the other hand.
Lie on an incline bench with a barbell. Press the bar up and together over your chest, then lower it back down.
Hold a kettlebell at chest level and squat down as if sitting in a chair. Return to standing.
Hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height. Squat down, then push through your heels to stand up and press the weights overhead.
Lie face down on a leg curl machine and curl the pad towards your glutes, then return to the starting position.
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with a neutral grip. Curl the weights up towards your shoulders.
Hold the end of a barbell anchored in a landmine attachment. Squat down, then push through your heels to stand up and press the bar overhead.
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Curl the weights up with a supinated grip, then rotate your wrists and lower them with a pronated grip.
Kneel in front of a cable machine with a rope attachment. Crunch down, bringing your elbows towards your knees while keeping your back straight.
Start in a plank position with your feet on a stability ball. Roll the ball towards your hands by piking your hips towards the ceiling.
Stand with the balls of your feet on the edge of a step. Raise your heels as high as possible, then lower them back down.
Stand facing a cable machine with a handle attached to the low pulley. Extend your arm straight back, then return to the starting position.
Start in a high plank position. As you lower your body, bring one knee towards your elbow, then push back up and switch sides.
Attach a resistance band to a sturdy anchor behind you. Press the handles forward until your arms are fully extended.
Place one knee and hand on a bench for support. Row the dumbbell towards your torso with the other hand.
Lie on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand. Press the weights up and together over your chest, then lower them back down.
Sit at a preacher curl machine with your arms on the pad. Curl the handle towards your shoulders, then lower it back down.
Hang from a pull-up bar and tuck your knees towards your chest, then slowly lower them back down.
Lie on a decline bench with a dumbbell in each hand. Lower the weights to your chest, then press them back up.
Start on all fours and kick one leg straight back, squeezing your glutes at the top of the movement.
Sit at a chest press machine with your feet flat on the floor. Press the handles forward until your arms are fully extended.
Stand on one leg with the other leg extended in front of you. Lower your hips until your thigh is parallel to the floor, then push back up.
Start in a high plank position with a dumbbell in each hand. Perform a push-up, then row each dumbbell towards your torso.
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, bend forward at the hips, and row the bar towards your torso.
Lie on a bench holding a dumbbell over your chest. Lower the weight behind your head, then pull it back up.
Sit on a bench under a Smith machine bar. Press the bar overhead until your arms are fully extended.
Stand sideways to a cable machine with the handle at the high pulley. Pull the handle down across your body in a chopping motion.
Sit on a back extension machine with your feet braced. Extend your hips to lift your torso, then lower back down.
Lie face down on a leg curl machine and curl the pad towards your glutes, then return to the starting position.
Sit on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height. Press the weights overhead until your arms are fully extended.
Start in a forearm plank position with a weight plate on your back. Hold the position while keeping your body straight.
Step continuously on a revolving staircase, keeping a steady pace.
Attach a resistance band to a sturdy anchor. Pull the handles towards your torso, keeping your elbows close to your body.
Hold a dumbbell in each hand and step forward into a lunge. Push back to the starting position and repeat on the other leg.
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with an overhand grip. Curl the weights up towards your shoulders.
Loop a resistance band around a pull-up bar and place your knees in the band. Pull your body up until your chin is above the bar.
Attach a rope handle to a high cable pulley. Pull the handle towards your face, leading with your elbows.
Lie on your back holding a kettlebell overhead. Stand up while keeping the kettlebell above your head, then return to lying.
Sit on the floor with knees bent, holding a medicine ball. Twist your torso to each side, tapping the ball on the floor.
Stand facing a cable machine with the handle at the low pulley. Raise the handle in front of you until your arm is parallel to the floor.
Lie on your back with legs extended towards the ceiling. Lift your hips off the ground, bringing your knees towards your chest.
Stand facing a cable machine with a handle attached to the low pulley. Extend your arm straight back, then return to the starting position.
Lie on your side with your top leg on a bench and your bottom leg extended. Lift your hips to form a straight line from head to heels.
Lie on an incline bench under a Smith machine bar. Press the bar up and together over your chest, then lower it back down.
Sit at a lat pulldown machine, grasp the bar with a wide grip, and pull it down to your chest. Slowly return to the starting position.
Attach a handle to a low pulley and stand to the side of the cable machine. Step out into a side lunge, then return to the starting position.
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, bend forward at the hips, and row the dumbbells towards your torso.
Step out to the side, bending one knee while keeping the other leg straight. Push back to the starting position.
Sit at a rowing machine with feet braced. Pull the handles towards your torso, then slowly return to the starting position.
Sit on a decline bench with your knees bent. Twist your torso to each side, tapping your hands on the floor.
Start with a barbell on the ground, perform a deadlift, and as you stand up, pull the barbell up towards your chest.
Sit at a lat pulldown machine with a reverse grip. Pull the bar down to your chest, then slowly return to the starting position.
Attach a handle to a low pulley and stand to the side of the cable machine. Step out into a side lunge, then return to the starting position.
Start in a downward dog position with your hips raised. Lower your head towards the floor, then push back up.
Start with a dumbbell between your feet. Explosively pull the dumbbell up and overhead in one motion.
Attach a rope handle to a low pulley and stand facing the cable machine. Squat down while holding the rope at chest height.
Squat down and grab the edge of a tire. Lift the tire and flip it forward.
Stand under the bar of a Smith machine with the balls of your feet on a step. Raise your heels as high as possible, then lower them back down.
Stand on one leg in front of a box. Lower your hips until you sit on the box, then stand back up.
Stand in the middle of a cable machine with handles in each hand. Bring the handles together in front of your chest, then return to the starting position.
Attach a harness to a sled and drag it across a flat surface, walking or running backwards.
Stand facing a cable machine with the handle attached to the low pulley. Curl the handle towards your shoulders with a neutral grip.
Stand facing away from a cable machine with the handle attached to the low pulley. Extend the handle overhead until your arms are fully extended.
Sit at a cable row machine with feet braced. Pull the handle towards your torso, then slowly return to the starting position.
Lie on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand. Lower the weights towards your head by bending your elbows, then extend your arms back to the starting position.
Hang a weight from your waist and perform a pull-up, bringing your chin above the bar.
Lie face down on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand. Row the weights towards your torso, then lower them back down.
Sit at a lat pulldown machine with a wide grip. Pull the bar down to your chest, then slowly return to the starting position.
Stand facing a cable machine with the handle attached to the low pulley. Row the handle towards your torso with one hand.
Attach a rope handle to a high cable pulley. Pull the handle towards your face, leading with your elbows.
Lie on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand. Press the weights up and together over your chest, then lower them back down.
